snippet: Letters released by the European Central Bank show how Ireland’s government was left with little alternative but to apply for the bailout.
abstract: Newly released documents suggest that Ireland was pressured into controversial 67.5 billion euro bailout that left taxpayers rescuing crippled banks; documents also illustrate European Central Bank's role in determining scope of aid program; disclosure reignites fierce debate about the package.

byline.contributor:
Douglas Dalby contributed reporting
from Dublin.

lead_paragraph: Letters released by the European Central Bank show how Ireland’s government was left with little alternative but to apply for the bailout.

headline.main: E.C.B. Threatened to End Funding Unless Ireland Took Bailout, Letters Show
headline.print_headline: Letters From E.C.B. Suggest It Pushed Ireland Into a Paralyzing Bailout
